content: Yes, you can plot all of the B values on the same graph without repeating the steps. To do this, you can select all of the B values and the Angle (Radians) column, and then create a chart using those values. In Excel, this can be done by highlighting all of the relevant cells, going to the "Insert" tab, and selecting the type of chart you want (such as a line chart or scatter plot). You can then customize the chart as needed, such as adding a trendline or adjusting the axis labels.
